Infinite quaternionic projective space is not a H-space

Apr 7, 2020

Just wanted to post two cute proofs that I came up with for the following statement: the -localization of is not a H-space for any .

Here’s one proof. We know that , and . So, if is such that , then we have

so . But if was a H-space, we’d have a self-map such that : namely, the th power map . So this congruence would have to hold for all integers , and that’s a problem.

Here is a more complicated argument. We know that all Whitehead products vanish in H-spaces, so it suffices to find a nontrivial Whitehead product in (again, -localized). Consider the generator . Then, the -fold Whitehead product lives in . This Whitehead product is -torsion: in fact, under the isomorphism , this Whitehead product is just .
